commit_message:
Add environment variables for better var handling

This change introduces two new environment variables into the tripleoclient
ansible runner funtion. These variables will ensure that var handling is
done in the most performant way possible without requiring the user to
make changes to their host level configuration.

Assosiated bug: https://github.com/ansible/ansible/issues/73653
Depends-On: https://review.opendev.org/c/openstack/ansible-role-chrony/+/776808
Depends-On: https://review.opendev.org/c/openstack/tripleo-heat-templates/+/775709
Depends-On: https://review.opendev.org/c/openstack/tripleo-ansible/+/775708
Depends-On: https://review.opendev.org/c/openstack/tripleo-common/+/776971
Related-Bug: #1915761
Signed-off-by: Kevin Carter <kecarter@redhat.com>
Change-Id: If922ae27db427e79a26964267945f5518fe8f120

revisions:
[{'created': '2021-03-01 10:22:17.000000000', 'message': "Adapt the documentation to use process_auto_release

The doc is outdated and `list_library_unreleased_changes.sh` produce a
list of changes that can't be consumed directly by `process_auto_release`.

`list_library_unreleased_changes` should be updated to only provide
pojects name. `process_auto_release` already provide list of diff so we
don't need to duplicate that.

Also fixing a wrong command name.

Change-Id: I59e4adaf19095ec0569bf86ddf1e4b99f440dda2
"}]
commit_message:
Adapt the documentation to use process_auto_release

The doc is outdated and `list_library_unreleased_changes.sh` produce a
list of changes that can't be consumed directly by `process_auto_release`.

`list_library_unreleased_changes` should be updated to only provide
pojects name. `process_auto_release` already provide list of diff so we
don't need to duplicate that.

Also fixing a wrong command name.

Change-Id: I59e4adaf19095ec0569bf86ddf1e4b99f440dda2

Update the cirros version to 0.5.1

We are hitting random timeout issues when intances trying to get
metadata. This version includes a fix for this [1].

[1] https://github.com/cirros-dev/cirros/pull/11/commits/e40bcd2964aa496a9d03e1aaf95cf7a86938f129

subject: Fix Subnet retrival when creating Service without Selector
messages: [{'account_id': 27032, 'date': '2021-03-03 03:18:48.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 23567, 'date': '2021-03-03 08:02:08.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+2'}, {'account_id': 13692, 'date': '2021-03-03 10:59:10.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+2'}, {'account_id': 11600, 'date': '2021-03-03 11:48:40.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+2 Workflow+1\n\nThanks!'}]
revisions:
[{'created': '2021-03-03 03:18:48.000000000', 'message': "Fix Subnet retrival when creating Service without Selector

When retrieving a Subnet for creating the LB member with OVN
for a SVC without selector, only the subnet is retrieved
when it should be the subnet and the cidr, as it's needed
to verify whether the member ip is present on the cidr.
This commit fixes the issue by calling the correct method.

Change-Id: I3288d849d1ad427b837cda2e07a8c971237cb303
Closes-bug: 1917557
"}]
commit_message:
Fix Subnet retrival when creating Service without Selector

When retrieving a Subnet for creating the LB member with OVN
for a SVC without selector, only the subnet is retrieved
when it should be the subnet and the cidr, as it's needed
to verify whether the member ip is present on the cidr.
This commit fixes the issue by calling the correct method.

Change-Id: I3288d849d1ad427b837cda2e07a8c971237cb303
Closes-bug: 1917557

commit_message:
Add hirsute and remove trusty from metadata.yaml

This update adds the new hirsute Ubuntu release (21.04) and
removes trusty support (14.04 which is EOL at 21.04).

Change-Id: Ie59209ea8be926c6ddf89fb87e24f938709e44ff

commit_message:
Initial Project scoped tests

This patch proposes initial tests to perform validations in relation
to supporting project scope access in a deployment where system scope
is also delineated.

For now, these tests have been disabled with the exception of tests
whose scopes are unexpected to see project scope support.

* conductors
* drivers
* chassis
* deploy_templates

Change-Id: I29c2ea987464b5b210808d9ca806292b8ab2ddf4

revisions:
[{'created': '2021-03-01 09:33:15.000000000', 'message': "Release final castellan for Wallaby

This proposed a release for castellan to get any final merged changes
out prior to the lib freeze for Wallaby going into effect.

[{'created': '2021-02-24 15:34:30.000000000', 'message': "Improve error handling on target query

The command 'iscsiadm -m node' will return entries for corrupt targets
in the form '[]:port,-1' instead of the expected format.  This causes an
IndexError exception during parsing.  This patch skips invalid entries.

Closes-bug: #1886855
Change-Id: I9a1746658474c0f1be7ec29a36767085aaf2ab7f
(cherry picked from commit 4fabe1b33d497b5f017f07b4b5d7fce0c0eabd00)
(cherry picked from commit 958e4f5fb8ec788fe92eff67eeb3adf0ab7b06a8)

"}]
commit_message:
Improve error handling on target query

The command 'iscsiadm -m node' will return entries for corrupt targets
in the form '[]:port,-1' instead of the expected format.  This causes an
IndexError exception during parsing.  This patch skips invalid entries.

Closes-bug: #1886855
Change-Id: I9a1746658474c0f1be7ec29a36767085aaf2ab7f
(cherry picked from commit 4fabe1b33d497b5f017f07b4b5d7fce0c0eabd00)
(cherry picked from commit 958e4f5fb8ec788fe92eff67eeb3adf0ab7b06a8)
(cherry picked from commit 897dbdb9a1b0e87fe6c81219c4bee4ffd2585e7b)

commit_message:
Infrastructure for callback unit tests

Eventually all of these are going to fill up with test cases.
Right now they merely demarcate boundaries of future testing.

Under ideal circumstances, every new callback review should be accompanied
by a tied review for test coverage.

Signed-off-by: Jiri Podivin <jpodivin@redhat.com>
Change-Id: Ie7b8389d386ff1a2533418a63888f43a899bb31c

Remove tripleo-multinode-container-minimal from zuul layout

as part of wider tripleo CI optimization at [2].

[1] Ie6473759383bd4b903cbe56fba9fee75a24154c4
[2] https://review.opendev.org/q/topic:tripleo-ci-reduce

commit_message:

Fixes several typos, expands help for positional arguments,
prints out default values of optional arguments
and changes help formatter to allow more control over output.

subject: Fix api call to get_deployment_status
revisions:
[{'created': '2021-02-24 21:16:32.000000000', 'message': "Fix api call to get_deployment_status

Function get_deployment_status requires the stack_name parameter, cannot pass plan=plan

Without fix, getting this error:

openstack tripleo validator run --group pre-update-prepare --plan overcloud
get_deployment_status() got an unexpected keyword argument 'plan'

Co-authored-by: Daniel Bengtsson <dbengt@redhat.com>
Change-Id: I7b5da62a564c22738427632ea03b1e33cdf2f89a
"}]
commit_message:
Fix api call to get_deployment_status

Function get_deployment_status requires the stack_name parameter, cannot pass plan=plan

Without fix, getting this error:

openstack tripleo validator run --group pre-update-prepare --plan overcloud
get_deployment_status() got an unexpected keyword argument 'plan'

Co-authored-by: Daniel Bengtsson <dbengt@redhat.com>
Change-Id: I7b5da62a564c22738427632ea03b1e33cdf2f89a

revisions:
[{'created': '2021-02-16 09:22:49.000000000', 'message': "Always set NetworkDeploymentActions to its default

There are instances users use ``NetworkDeploymentActions`` to
do network configuration during update, but just drop the
parameter for subsequent updates. This sometimes results in
network configuration changes in existing nodes and disruptions.
Let's always set them to defaults unless overridden explicitly.

Change-Id: Ibe7925e4ee568d3d45e138d543b6d7064a8503a3
Related: https://bugzilla.redhat.com/1928055
(cherry picked from commit 92dcffc714bc92a28f610bf0322f04551aade758)
"}]
commit_message:
Always set NetworkDeploymentActions to its default

There are instances users use ``NetworkDeploymentActions`` to
do network configuration during update, but just drop the
parameter for subsequent updates. This sometimes results in
network configuration changes in existing nodes and disruptions.
Let's always set them to defaults unless overridden explicitly.

Change-Id: Ibe7925e4ee568d3d45e138d543b6d7064a8503a3
Related: https://bugzilla.redhat.com/1928055
(cherry picked from commit 92dcffc714bc92a28f610bf0322f04551aade758)

commit_message:
Train-only make tripleo_diff_exec py2-compatible

Train still supports centos-7 and subprocess.run() did not exist
there.

Tested on train on both cents 8 and 7.

Change-Id: I0b1a288fb3b1ae8d748690e4415a5c58ce793595
Closes-Bug: #1917422

commit_message:
Handle agent still doing the prior command

The agent command exec model is based upon an incoming
heartbeat, however heartbeats are independent and
commands can take a long time. For example, software RAID
setup in CI can encounter this.

From an IPA log:

[-] Picked root device /dev/md0 for node c6ca0af2-baec-40d6-879d-cbb5c751aafb
    based on root device hints {'name': '/dev/md0'}
[-] Attempting to download image from http://199.204.45.248:3928/agent_images/
    c6ca0af2-baec-40d6-879d-cbb5c751aafb
[-] Executing command: standby.get_partition_uuids with args: {} execute_command
    /usr/local/lib/python3.6/site-packages/ironic_python_agent/extensions/base.py:255
[-] Tried to execute standby.get_partition_uuids, agent is still executing Command name:
    execute_deploy_step, params: {'step': {'interface': 'deploy', 'step': 'write_image',
    'args': {'image_info': {'id': 'cb9e199a-af1b-4a6f-b00e-f284008b8046',
    'urls': ['http://199.204.45.248:3928/agent_images/c6ca0af2-baec-40d6-879d-cbb5c751aafb'],
    'disk_format': 'raw', 'container_format': 'bare', 'stream_raw_images': True, 'os_hash_algo':
    'sha512', 'os_hash_value':<trimed>

This was with code built on master, using master images.
Inside the conductor log, it notes that it is likely an out
of date agent because only AgentAPIError is evaluated,
however any API error is evaluated this way. In reality, we need
to explicitly flag *when* we have an error that is because
we've tried to soon as something is already being worked upon.

The result, is to evaluate and return an exception indicating work
is already in flight.

Update - It looks like, the original fix to prevent busy agent
recognition did not fully detect all cases as getting steps is a
command which can
get skipped by accident with a busy agent, under certain circumstances.
Change I5d86878b5ed6142ed2630adee78c0867c49b663f in ironic-python-agent
also changed the string that was being checked for the previous
handling, where we really should have just made the string we were
checking lower case in ironic. Oh well! This should fix things
right up.

Story: 2008167
Task: 41175
Change-Id: Ia169640b7084d17d26f22e457c7af512db6d21d6
(cherry picked from commit 545dc2106b757e69d473c2997bbb2ac34fc131d3)

I think we need a documentation change to indicate what is needed from a firmware or backend level for the iSCSI support to work.'}, {'account_id': 9535, 'date': '2021-01-27 14:58:53.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3: Code-Review-1

(2 comments)

-1: Please update the documentation to mention the requirements for Primera iSCSI to work with Cinder (firmware, REST-API version, etc.).'}, {'account_id': 5314, 'date': '2021-01-27 21:23:26.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3: Code-Review-2

(1 comment)

The -2 is just to put a hold on this so it doesn't merge prematurely.  Please address Gorka's comments and increment the version number of the driver (see comment inline).

I don't have a problem with the patch itself; the driver has already existed in cinder, you're just removing the code that prevents it from running with a Primera backend.  So there's not a question of this being a new driver, and hence, it's not subject to the new driver merge deadline.  (But as Gorka pointed out, it would be helpful to update the docs and release note to explain under what circumstances this driver can be used with Primera.)

A -2 is "sticky", so please ping me in the cinder channel when you post the new patch set so and I'll lift the -2.'}, {'account_id': 29122, 'date': '2021-01-28 06:07:52.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3:

Thanks Ivan, Jay, Gorka, Brian.

commit_message:
3PAR: Allow iSCSI driver to be enabled for Primera 4.2 onwards.

For HPE Primera 4.2 or higher versions, now iSCSI driver is
supported along with existing FC driver.
Accordingly updated code and documentation.

Change-Id: Ie2542fc4b21050c4f14aea67ea488d9f9eeaae79

commit_message:
Add hirsute and remove trusty from metadata.yaml

This update adds the new hirsute Ubuntu release (21.04) and
removes trusty support (14.04 which is EOL at 21.04).

Change-Id: I6121fe56f684d7738ef19ce04275d3165e1df506

Hi Tim,

Would you be OK with releasing python-swiftclient 3.9.1 for stable/ussuri? This would fix an annoying issue with Horizon and Ceph Object Gateway.'}, {'account_id': 15343, 'date': '2021-01-07 18:27:42.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 2.'}, {'account_id': 15343, 'date': '2021-01-07 18:30:42.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 2: Code-Review+2 Workflow+1

Thanks for this! We've typically not done many stable tags for python-swiftclient (since the expectation is that new swiftclient should be compatible with arbitrarily-old versions of both servers and clients), but if it's fixing a bug that impacts other projects like this, it certainly seems worth doing!"}, {'account_id': 15343, 'date': '2021-01-08 23:52:52.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2:

messages:
[{'account_id': 32926, 'date': '2021-03-03 09:53:31.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 24162, 'date': '2021-03-03 09:57:23.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review-1

I am against this move at it will degrade the UX for people linting code locally.

The garbage is caused by Zuul related bug, is better to fix the root cause instead of punishing everyone for it.'}, {'account_id': 24162, 'date': '2021-03-03 10:00:28.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review-2

You should be able to achieve this by altering the job definition and defining the terminal as dumb.
https://github.com/pre-commit/pre-commit/issues/1073

I think that the linter will also respect the value  of the TERM too.'}, {'account_id': 32926, 'date': '2021-03-03 10:37:07.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

> Patch Set 1: Code-Review-2
>

>

Well if that's a possibility sure. Abandoning the review."}, {'account_id': 32926, 'date': '2021-03-03 10:37:46.000000000', 'content': 'Abandoned

input from zbr'}]
revisions:
[{'created': '2021-03-03 09:53:31.000000000', 'message': 'ansible-lint will no longer colorize its output

The result was needlesly confusing when appearing in zuul
reports as it inserted ascii strings for color encoding
and added little in readability on personal terminals.

For example, with coloring enabled:
[34mroles/switch_vlans/tasks/main.yml[0m:2:3: [91msyntax-check[0m

Without coloring:
roles/switch_vlans/tasks/main.yml:2:3: syntax-check

Signed-off-by: Jiri Podivin <jpodivin@redhat.com>
Change-Id: I639bbd5ef5b80777ee18c2dce0b16ab6f5066476
'}]
commit_message:
ansible-lint will no longer colorize its output

The result was needlesly confusing when appearing in zuul
reports as it inserted ascii strings for color encoding
and added little in readability on personal terminals.

For example, with coloring enabled:
[34mroles/switch_vlans/tasks/main.yml[0m:2:3: [91msyntax-check[0m

Without coloring:
roles/switch_vlans/tasks/main.yml:2:3: syntax-check

Signed-off-by: Jiri Podivin <jpodivin@redhat.com>
Change-Id: I639bbd5ef5b80777ee18c2dce0b16ab6f5066476

Looks good per https://github.com/openvswitch/ovs/blob/master/Documentation/faq/configuration.rst (Q: Does Open vSwitch support IPv6 GRE?)'}, {'account_id': 11975, 'date': '2021-03-02 14:48:53.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

revisions:
[{'created': '2021-03-02 12:05:32.000000000', 'message': 'Fix wrong packet_type set for IPv6 GRE tunnels in OVS

In patch [1] it was by mistake set to "legacy" but it should be
"legacy_l2".
This patch fixes that mistake.

Closes-bug: #1917448

[1] https://review.opendev.org/c/openstack/neutron/+/763204

Change-Id: Idb743bbfd5454b8d245c4dd4b8c3d7021e90d238
'}]
commit_message:
Fix wrong packet_type set for IPv6 GRE tunnels in OVS

In patch [1] it was by mistake set to "legacy" but it should be
"legacy_l2".
This patch fixes that mistake.

Closes-bug: #1917448

[1] https://review.opendev.org/c/openstack/neutron/+/763204

Change-Id: Idb743bbfd5454b8d245c4dd4b8c3d7021e90d238

messages:
[{'account_id': 27775, 'date': '2021-03-01 19:25:05.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 27900, 'date': '2021-03-03 10:14:07.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review-1

(1 comment)

Once https://review.opendev.org/c/openstack/openstacksdk/+/766783 will land it will stop working and you will not even notice due to absence of test with this extension.
You need to also add those attributes in https://opendev.org/openstack/openstacksdk/src/branch/master/openstack/network/v2/port.py (and in the corresponding test)'}]
revisions:
[{'created': '2021-03-01 19:25:05.000000000', 'message': 'Add dns_name, dns_domain parameters to create/update port.

The Port class supports the dns_name and dns_domain parameters.
This commit allows specifying these attributes whe creating/updating ports.

Change-Id: I597407fcf9eb6b41e448d4b2d70eba2670deef95
Signed-off-by: dariko <git@dariozanzico.com>
'}]
commit_message:
Add dns_name, dns_domain parameters to create/update port.

The Port class supports the dns_name and dns_domain parameters.
This commit allows specifying these attributes whe creating/updating ports.

Change-Id: I597407fcf9eb6b41e448d4b2d70eba2670deef95
Signed-off-by: dariko <git@dariozanzico.com>

commit_message:
Remove shebang from scripts

Without this, heat container agents using  kubectl version
1.18.x (e.g. ussuri-dev) fail because they do not have the correct
KUBECONFIG in the environment.

Task: 39938
Story: 2007591

Change-Id: Ifc212478ae09c658adeb6ba4c8e8afc8943e3977
(cherry picked from commit 799563eb613855c340727c6b87c2e1ddd490aae3)

revisions:
[{'created': '2020-11-19 21:17:02.000000000', 'message': 'Implement secure RBAC for storage pool statistics

commit_message:
Implement secure RBAC for storage pool statistics

This commit updates the policies for storage pool statistics to understand
scope checking and account for a read-only role. This is part of a broader
series of changes across OpenStack to provide a consistent RBAC experience and
improve security.

Change-Id: I99af5f4f9bfc7e0718c618c95206b7051b724c73

commit_message:
Deploy traefik from the heat-agent

Use kubectl from the heat agent to apply the
traefik deployment. Current behaviour was to
create a systemd unit to send the manifests
to the API.

This way we will have only one way for applying
manifests to the API.

This change is triggered to adddress the kubectl
change [0] that is not using 127.0.0.1:8080 as
the default kubernetes API.

[0] https://github.com/kubernetes/kubernetes/blob/master/CHANGELOG/CHANGELOG-1.18.md#kubectl

story: 2005286
task: 39522

Change-Id: I8982bd4ec2ab69f35938970d604c16ac5e62e1fa
Signed-off-by: Spyros Trigazis <spyridon.trigazis@cern.ch>
(cherry picked from commit 3e7924ffda45a1d750700ff1e86019359f90870c)

revisions:
[{'created': '2021-03-01 08:08:12.000000000', 'message': 'Fix overriding default listener timeout values in config file

The default value for timeout parameters in the BaseListenerType was
not correctly set because the class was defined before reading the
config file.

Story 2008666
Task 41953

Change-Id: Ia4aa2047a79ad6fc3e33c7ebe2da9438914f7a88
'}]
commit_message:
Fix overriding default listener timeout values in config file

The default value for timeout parameters in the BaseListenerType was
not correctly set because the class was defined before reading the
config file.

Story 2008666
Task 41953

Change-Id: Ia4aa2047a79ad6fc3e33c7ebe2da9438914f7a88

revisions:
[{'created': '2021-01-22 12:56:43.000000000', 'message': 'Style adjustment of a constant.

Perhaps slight exaggeration. The value is set just after imports,
depending on a single condition, but before declaring anything else.

Thus making it quasi-constant.
Still, it is beneficial from readability perspective.

Signed-off-by: Jiri Podivin <jpodivin@redhat.com>
Change-Id: Ieddc2cabd2612fa406a9660daa17a836ea1ee4cf
'}]
commit_message:
Style adjustment of a constant.

Perhaps slight exaggeration. The value is set just after imports,
depending on a single condition, but before declaring anything else.

Thus making it quasi-constant.
Still, it is beneficial from readability perspective.

Signed-off-by: Jiri Podivin <jpodivin@redhat.com>
Change-Id: Ieddc2cabd2612fa406a9660daa17a836ea1ee4cf

It seems the latest 2.2.12 requires rake>13.0 installed and that
requirement doesn't work well in current our CI jobs.
Let's pin it to the previous version until we resolve the issue

Note that this change only covers library jobs and we also need the
same fix for puppet-openstack-integration later.

This change also removes the pin for the very old Ruby version.

Closes-Bug: #1917457
Change-Id: Ibafcb3b994db361df3427ca2afe4dd3d08028add
(cherry picked from commit a75cf9b6b18134cd6b1285740e2941bb228e053b)
"}]
commit_message:
pin bundler to 2.2.11

It seems the latest 2.2.12 requires rake>13.0 installed and that
requirement doesn't work well in current our CI jobs.
Let's pin it to the previous version until we resolve the issue

Note that this change only covers library jobs and we also need the
same fix for puppet-openstack-integration later.

This change also removes the pin for the very old Ruby version.

Closes-Bug: #1917457
Change-Id: Ibafcb3b994db361df3427ca2afe4dd3d08028add
(cherry picked from commit a75cf9b6b18134cd6b1285740e2941bb228e053b)

If QoS service plugin is not loaded, the L3 QoS extension in the OVN
L3 plugin should not be loaded neither.

Prior to this patch, the extension drivers were checked to find the
QoS extension. Although it is a misconfiguration to have the QoS
extension without loading the QoS driver, that is handled correctly

QoS extension. Although it is a misconfiguration to have the QoS

by the Neutron server, disabling the extension silently.

commit_message:
Do not load "qos-fip" if "qos" plugin is not loaded

If QoS service plugin is not loaded, the L3 QoS extension in the OVN
L3 plugin should not be loaded neither.

Prior to this patch, the extension drivers were checked to find the
QoS extension. Although it is a misconfiguration to have the QoS
extension without loading the QoS driver, that is handled correctly
by the Neutron server, disabling the extension silently.

Closes-Bug: #1898842
Related-Bug: #1877408

Change-Id: Iea5ff76fe652ab1c04e23850b9259547c1d54365
(cherry picked from commit 7e31f2ae41b4512afd2b3dd4fb72fcd16ef0a373)

commit_message:
ovn: Collect OVN logs

OVN logs have moved from /var/log/openvswitch that is collected by the
base job to /var/log/ovn

Co-Authored-By: Lucas Alvares Gomes <lucasagomes@gmail.com>

Change-Id: I1e9fe661f55e99ca509dfbc3c1334b358ddb7212

[{'created': '2021-03-02 15:19:57.000000000', 'message': 'Remove default parameter from execute

The param check_exit_code from the processutils extension execute has
default already at [0]
See:
https://opendev.org/openstack/oslo.concurrency/src/branch/master/oslo_concurrency/processutils.py#L214

Change-Id: Iedff5325e0737556d5eb3da601c984ddfc633873
'}]
commit_message:
Remove default parameter from execute

The param check_exit_code from the processutils extension execute has
default already at [0]
See:
https://opendev.org/openstack/oslo.concurrency/src/branch/master/oslo_concurrency/processutils.py#L214

Change-Id: Iedff5325e0737556d5eb3da601c984ddfc633873

Btw, forgot to ask. There's an element called "grub2" that seems to overlap a little with what is being proposed here (at least when it comes to package installation). Should we merge the bootloader element with the grub2 element you think?'}, {'account_id': 16347, 'date': '2016-03-22 12:57:24.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 15:

(1 comment)

Yes, we need to merge bootloader and grub2 elements. Also, i see lot of common code in multiple OS elements related to grub. We need to consolidate everything. May be a TODO is required for this. I'll add TODO if i put another patch."}, {'account_id': 11297, 'date': '2016-03-23 05:06:59.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 15: Code-Review-1

(6 comments)

Some couple of queries inlined.'}, {'account_id': 11297, 'date': '2016-03-23 05:07:42.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 15:

WIll this create DUAL bootable image when the env variable and vm element is used together?'}, {'account_id': 16347, 'date': '2016-03-24 12:46:25.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 15:

(6 comments)

This patch is for creating images for UEFI boot only. Dual boot is not supported.'}, {'account_id': 11297, 'date': '2016-03-29 11:35:16.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 15:

(4 comments)'}, {'account_id': 11297, 'date': '2016-03-29 11:37:24.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 15:

Please add in the README that when teh env variable is used with the element it doesnt create dual bootable image rather its UEFI only image.'}, {'account_id': 11297, 'date': '2016-03-29 11:39:21.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 15:

It would be better to rename the env variable as "DIB_UEFI_ONLY_WHOLE_DISK_IMAGE" rather than "DIB_UEFI_SUPPORT".'}, {'account_id': 16347, 'date': '2016-03-29 16:50:00.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 15:

(3 comments)

From our understanding DIB generates whole disk images only. So, it does not makes sense to name it as WHOLE_DISK. We need to add TODO for dual boot image. If this is the case we cannot rename it during every change in my opinion.'}, {'account_id': 10035, 'date': '2016-04-02 15:30:50.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 15: Code-Review+1

(1 comment)

If we want to add support for multiple bootable partitions we can add anther variable then and get the same results. Also. DIB only makes single images AFAIK (someone downstream could have made an element to do multiples though and we would have no idea).'}, {'account_id': 10035, 'date': '2016-04-02 15:31:06.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 15:

One minor nit about adding a comment, otherwise LGTM.'}, {'account_id': 12411, 'date': '2016-04-04 07:23:36.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 16.'}, {'account_id': 3, 'date': '2016-04-04 08:02:54.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 16: Verified+1

Some small comments from software design perspective.

I see some general issues here:
1. Spread knowledge
2. Assumptions & Missing Generality
3. Complexity

1. Spread knowledge
   Instead of having all implementations / knowledge at one place, it is spread through the code. IMHO it would be better to check / set the behavior at one place (ONE 'if test -n "${DIB_UEFI_SUPPORT}") and set / handle all the different functionality there.

2. Assumptions & Missing Generality
   There are some assumptions in the code, like using p2 as UEFI (vm/block-device.d/10-partition)
   Can you please explain how this fits together with partitioning-sfdisk where a user is able to create arbitrary partitions? 

   To name another example: you implemented the possibility to define the size of exactly one partition (DIB_UEFI_ESP_SIZE).
   Using this pattern, each and every new feature / element will add another variable for another (partition) size - e.g. DIB_SEPARATE_PARTITION_VAR_SIZE, DIB_PARTITION_TMP_SIZE, ...
   Why not introducing a general way of handling things here?

3. Complexity
   Many new lines of code are inserted into the already somewhat complex bootloader/finalise.d/50-bootloader.
   (This file has now the touch of Spaghetti code ;-) )
   Why was it done in this way?
   IMHO the natural way would have been to first factor out existing code into a new element (like bootloader-grub-bios), introduce a new element (like bootloader-grub-uefi) and extract all the common code into functions (like lib/bootloader-common).

Therefore IMHO this is not the way new functionality should be implemented - and because of this I vote with '-1'.


Some personal notes:
o Sorry for being late in the review process - but I found this patch only so me hours before.
o This is my first review for OpenStack (and I'm not a native speaker): please excuse when it sounds harsh - this is not my indention. 
o I have some experience in software development and saw *some* projects failing, because of very similar issues. And it's always like: let's add this small change to the existing code - we can refactor later (and you can guess, what's happening... :-) )
o I'm the author of a patch that tries to address the partitioning in a more general way: https://review.openstack.org/#/c/313938/1. Would be happy to get your feedback there!'}, {'account_id': 12411, 'date': '2016-05-09 10:59:38.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 18:

Hi Andreas,

Thanks for your comments. This patch adds the initial support for building UEFI based images in disk image builder. As further features step in, things will get more generalized.'}, {'account_id': 14288, 'date': '2016-05-09 14:12:07.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 18: Code-Review-1

Hi Andreas, If you observe the patch, you will find that we haven't added new coding style to disk image builder. We have extended the existing code to support building of UEFI boot based images. And in this, we have made sure to retain the same format as other features. 

Please go through disk image builder project in entirety for your reference."}, {'account_id': 10035, 'date': '2016-05-21 19:23:40.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 20: Code-Review-1

(1 comment)

I have one README nit but otherwise this LGTM. Something that would be really nice is if a test case for this was added - just to show that this element succeeds in building would be a big win.

Andreas - I don't think it hurts to add support for uefi to the bootloader element. I do like the idea of breaking out grub and uefi into separate elements but since bootloader is already a general purpose element it seems reasonable for it to support different bootloaders. If someone would like to break out these in to separate elements later on that would be great.

For the other comments - Could you provide potential solutions for the other things you point out? I'd rather not hold up adding in this functionality unless there's either some kind of public interface issue (which we need to fix now to prevent backwards compat breakage) or if there's an obvious better thing we should be doing without a ton of effort."}, {'account_id': 21741, 'date': '2016-05-22 09:37:30.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 20:

(4 comments)

As an introduction I'd like to say, that I like the functionality of this new element. Nevertheless there are IMHO some implementation drawbacks.

@Greg: Ok understood that you prefer having everything in one module. In this case there are possibilities to e.g. place some functions in the elements lib directory and use it. In my impression this 50-bootloader script gets more and more un-maintainable. Please have a look at the cyclomatic complexity in the new version.

@Greg: Looks that in one point we completely disagree:
> If someone would like to break out these in to separate elements later on that would be great.
This gives everybody the freedom to leave the biggest mess, because 'sometime later' 'somebody' could then cleanup ;-) . Did you ever see this happen?
IMHO the only working methodology is, that *before* a change is done, the existing code base is changed in the way that the change 'fits' in: the source code should get better, cleaner, better tested, better maintainable with each commit.
In my opinion this patch is a step in the wrong direction. (So if I were you, I'd reject any patch introducing new functionality without appropriate tests.)

You also asked about how potential solutions could look like.
I'm working for some time now on the 'lvm2' element [1] - which mostly tries to solve exactly this problem: instead of spreading around the knowledge, the complete configuration is hold in the element's environment.d directory - even with the possibility that a user can overwrite it. With this method the user can add one or even ten partitions or logical volumes without breaking any functionality.

IMHO a way forward to solve some problems could be to introduce a generic partitioning element that can be used from other elements. (No - the existing partitioning-sfdisk does not really help here.)
There exists a proposal for such a generic partitioning element already [2], but IMHO that will be a 'ton on work', because the infrastructure - let me express it nicely - lacks some functionality ;-)


[1] https://review.openstack.org/#/c/316529/
[2] https://review.openstack.org/#/c/313938/"}, {'account_id': 12411, 'date': '2016-05-23 07:11:33.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 21.'}, {'account_id': 3, 'date': '2016-05-23 07:44:18.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 21:

- gate-tripleo-ci-f22-nonha http://logs.openstack.org/84/287784/22/check-tripleo/gate-tripleo-ci-f22-nonha/6d13e06/ : FAILURE in 35m 12s'}, {'account_id': 14288, 'date': '2016-05-24 14:44:42.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 22: Code-Review+1'}, {'account_id': 10035, 'date': '2016-05-26 17:10:12.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 22: Code-Review-1'}, {'account_id': 10035, 'date': '2016-05-26 17:17:26.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 22: -Code-Review

@Andreas - I actually do agree that breaking this out in to multiple elements is nicer and is probably the correct way forward. I am just trying to weight the amount of work that will be versus the cost of adding in the complexity to the existing element and then fixing it up later.


What I want to avoid is a situation where we have an element named something generic (such as bootloader) but it only perform a specific subset of that functionality because another element (bootloader-efi) performs the rest. Given that we are very strict about backwards compatibility and we already have a generically named element we have to continue to support this regardless. Therefore, even if we do break it out in to separate element's I would still like to see this element implement all our bootloader functionality just to avoid the horrible confusion to users about 'why do you have a bootloader element that doesnt just work'."}, {'account_id': 10035, 'date': '2016-05-26 17:18:23.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 22:

To clarify a bit - having two element's bootloader-grub and bootloader-efi would be totally fine, just not bootloader, bootloader-efi."}, {'account_id': 21741, 'date': '2016-05-26 19:00:50.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 22:

@Greg: What do you think about a structure like?

* bootloader/finalize.d/50-bootloader 
* bootloader/lib/bootloader/extlinux/...
* bootloader/lib/bootloader/grub_bios/...
* bootloader/lib/bootloader/grub_uefi/...
* bootloader/lib/bootloader/common/...

(The second .../bootloader/... is needed to avoid name clashes during hook generation.)

'50-bootloader' is the main driver.  It calls - depending on configuration and other tests - the correct bootloader implementation

The whole bootloader implementation is currently 165 LOC - splitting it off should be not that much work.

For partition handling I would use an approach as implemented in refactoring the block-device layer [1].  This would give this element the possibility to configure the needed images and partitions (without touching things like 10-partitioning) and there would be no need to make assumptions (hard coding) of partition names any more.

Also the partitioning element is already available [2]. If the refactoring of block-devices [1] is the way to go, I can easily rebase [2] to [1].


[1] https://review.openstack.org/#/c/319591/
[2] https://review.openstack.org/#/c/313938/"}, {'account_id': 12411, 'date': '2016-05-30 05:51:54.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 22:

Hi Greg, Since this is a fairly tested code, can we merge this and take up refactoring in subsequent patches?'}, {'account_id': 10035, 'date': '2016-06-01 16:51:14.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 22: Code-Review-1

Andreas - I think youre hitting at something that we have some support for but we might need to generalize a bit more: a way for element's to have user selectable code-paths. We currently have a concept of 'installtypes' which basically does this, but I am not sure we really intended (or documented) for it to be used in this way. That might be worth rethinking. That being said, I don't think we need to solve that problem before this patch - it would be very straightforward to move this code in to that layout style (possibly as simple as copying it in to a dir).


I agree with Andreas' concerns about the coupling between vm and bootloader here: vm does depend on bootloader, but bootloader still needs to be useful beyond the vm element. Throwing around ideas - we have a concept of element-provides which can be used for virtual dependencies. Maybe bootloader can depend on efi-partitioning and partitioning element's can element-provides efi-partitioning if they support it?"}, {'account_id': 18781, 'date': '2016-06-02 05:58:16.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 22:

(1 comment)

I don't give a -1 for this though. But if it happens to create another patch, i strongly recommend to make this change and test it."}, {'account_id': 12459, 'date': '2016-06-13 23:17:29.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 22: Code-Review-1

(7 comments)

I have some more specific comments inline. 

I agree with the comments about adding tests. The developer documentation has some information on adding tests to elements.

I also second the comments about the dependency on the vm element.

I understand that making changes and refactoring things is a lot of work but the code that lands in the project needs to be reasonably robust and maintainable.'}, {'account_id': 11655, 'date': '2016-06-15 12:38:03.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 22: Code-Review-1

(3 comments)

Concerns and questions in-line.  I tend to agree with Greg however at the same time multiple individuals have attempted to remedy issues with UEFI image builds over the past year, which causes me to think a centralized approach may be best since there is code to handle the same tasks otherwise in the same places.'}, {'account_id': 5805, 'date': '2016-06-20 21:15:10.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 22: Code-Review-1

(4 comments)

Thank you Purandhar, looking at the patch think this should be split into two patch sets. I understand that you want to finalize this patch.  But there are IMHO two points that still does not allow to merge it.

1) Changes in the block device level
2) Some old remarks (e.g. from Greg any myself) are (still) not considered

ad 1) The changes in the block device that are already merged in v2 changes the setup of partitions completely.  The file vm/block-device.d/10-partition is gone - so changing this does not make sense (any more). Also your code in bootloader/finalise.d/50-bootloader:23 ff simply does not work any longer (you cannot make the assumption that it's always p1 or p2).

ad 2) You spread the implementation between two elements: vm and bootloader - but bootloader must also be working when not using the vm element (see Greg's comment from 2016-07-01; see my comment from 2016-05-09).

In addition: I have no chance to go for a +1/+2 because there is no test case and I have simply no way and knowledge to test it.  Can you please add a test case / description how to setup and test a VM using UEFI?

My proposal:
* Write a test case that creates / boots a VM using UEFI.
* Create a diskimage-builder/block-device/level1/gpt.py module to handle GPT partition schema. Do this atop https://review.openstack.org/#/c/426618/
* rebase this patch atop the new GPT patch
* Create a new element for UEFI boot and have there all the needed information and functionality.

I'd like to support here (especially for the GPT - should be not more than two or three hours work) - but first there is a need for a test case (which is missing anyway)."}, {'account_id': 3, 'date': '2017-02-06 09:25:25.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 38:

revisions:
[{'created': '2016-03-03 13:03:10.000000000', 'message': 'Add support for building images capable of UEFI [WIP]

This change adds support for to build images using diskimage-builder
which are capable to boot in UEFI based systems. Currently Ubuntu and Fedora
images have been tested and verified.

Change-Id: If1fb0abe3507a0fe2b6f5266e0e2e5b32d628c45
Signed-off-by: Purandhar Sairam Mannidi <mannidi@hpe.com>
'}, {'created': '2016-03-03 13:11:01.000000000', 'message': 'Add support for building images capable of UEFI [WIP]

This change adds support for to build images using diskimage-builder
which are capable to boot in UEFI based systems. Currently Ubuntu and Fedora
images have been tested and verified.

Change-Id: If1fb0abe3507a0fe2b6f5266e0e2e5b32d628c45
Signed-off-by: Purandhar Sairam Mannidi <mannidi@hpe.com>
'}, {'created': '2016-03-04 09:55:33.000000000', 'message': '[WIP] Add support for building images capable of UEFI

This change adds support for to build images using diskimage-builder
which are capable to boot in UEFI based systems. Currently Ubuntu and Fedora
images have been tested and verified.

To build an UEFI capable image,

1. Two Partions were created with GPT partition table. First partition
   contains the root file system, while the second partition is an EFI
   System Partition(ESP). parted is used for creating the partitions.

2. Bootloader element pkg-map has been added with grub-efi which
   installs dependent packages for default and redhat distributions.

3. As part of installing grub boot loader, the ESP partition is mounted
   to /boot/efi directory of the root file system so that grub will
   install required grubx64.efi and other dependent packages in ESP
   partition.

4. Grub configuration files are modified to work with respective
   distributions.

Change-Id: If1fb0abe3507a0fe2b6f5266e0e2e5b32d628c45
Signed-off-by: Purandhar Sairam Mannidi <mannidi@hpe.com>

This change adds support for to build images using diskimage-builder
which are capable to boot in UEFI based systems. Currently RHEL 7, CentOS 7,
Ubuntu, Debian and Fedora images have been tested and verified for
x86_64/amd64 architectures.

To build an UEFI capable image,

1. Two Partions were created with GPT partition table. First partition
   contains the root file system, while the second partition is an EFI
   System Partition(ESP). parted is used for creating the partitions.

2. Bootloader element pkg-map has been added with grub-efi which
   installs dependent packages for default and redhat distributions.

3. As part of installing grub boot loader, the ESP partition is mounted
   to /boot/efi directory of the root file system so that grub will
   install required grubx64.efi and other dependent packages in ESP
   partition.

4. Grub configuration files are modified to work with respective
   distributions.

Change-Id: If1fb0abe3507a0fe2b6f5266e0e2e5b32d628c45
Signed-off-by: Purandhar Sairam Mannidi <mannidi@hpe.com>

which are capable to boot in UEFI based systems. Currently RHEL 7, CentOS 7,
Ubuntu, Debian and Fedora images have been tested and verified for
x86_64/amd64 architectures.

To build an UEFI capable image,

1. Two Partions were created with GPT partition table. First partition
   contains the root file system, while the second partition is an EFI
   System Partition(ESP). parted is used for creating the partitions.

2. Bootloader element pkg-map has been added with grub-efi which
   installs dependent packages for default and redhat distributions.

3. As part of installing grub boot loader, the ESP partition is mounted
   to /boot/efi directory of the root file system so that grub will
   install required grubx64.efi and other dependent packages in ESP
   partition.

   distributions.

commit_message:
Add support for building images capable of UEFI

This change adds support for to build images using diskimage-builder
which are capable to boot in UEFI based systems. Currently RHEL 7, CentOS 7,
Ubuntu, Debian and Fedora images have been tested and verified for
x86_64/amd64 architectures.

To build an UEFI capable image,

1. Two Partions were created with GPT partition table. First partition
   contains the EFI System Partition(ESP), while the second partition is
   the root file system. parted is used for creating the partitions.

2. Bootloader element pkg-map has been added with grub-efi which
   installs dependent packages for default and redhat distributions.

3. As part of installing grub boot loader, the ESP partition is mounted
   to /boot/efi directory of the root file system so that grub will
   install required grubx64.efi and other dependent packages in ESP
   partition.

4. Grub configuration files are modified to work with respective
   distributions.

Change-Id: If1fb0abe3507a0fe2b6f5266e0e2e5b32d628c45
Signed-off-by: Purandhar Sairam Mannidi <mannidi@hpe.com>

Conflicts:
	doc/source/user_guide/supported_distros.rst

Change-Id: If1fb0abe3507a0fe2b6f5266e0e2e5b32d628c45

commit_message:
Fix designate driver: allow_reverse_dns_lookup doesn't works if dns_domain zone wasn't created.

Fixes LP Bug #1904559.

Change-Id: I9bf55fe4521559063090608bf2c206ea633296ba

revisions:
[{'created': '2021-03-01 09:48:37.000000000', 'message': "Release final sushy for Wallaby

This proposed a release for sushy to get any final merged changes

commit_message:
Release final sushy for Wallaby

This proposed a release for sushy to get any final merged changes
out prior to the lib freeze for Wallaby going into effect.

If the team is ready to proceed, please leave a +1 to acknowledge this
release and we will process right away. If the team is working on any
final merges, leave a -1 with some detail on the status and update the
patch with the new commit hash to use when ready.

Patches with no response will be merged by Monday, March 8.

$ git log --oneline --no-merges 3.6.1..d4c7e03
375b29b Follow up TaskMonitor refactor
7a9a2b6 Refactor TaskMonitor and update Volume methods
07ca7f4 Don't log ERROR if GET of /redfish/v1/SessionService fails
d9004ec Fix deprecation on collections.MutableMapping
09cee5c Automatically retry HTTP 5xx on GET requests
4abea18 Initial support for secure boot databases

Signed-off-by: Hervé Beraud <hberaud@redhat.com>
Change-Id: I1e6ee139d84ec49ea331028818995f63513fa599

Remove tripleo-multinode-container|baremetal-minimal from layout

The tripleo-multinode-container-minimal and -baremetal-minimal
templates are being deprecated [1] as part of wider tripleo CI
optimization at [2].

[2] https://review.opendev.org/q/topic:tripleo-ci-reduce

commit_message:
Cluster aware Glance with RabbitMQ

This change provides the basic functionality of cluster
messaging for glance-api services.

Initial usecase the 'glance-direct' image import is
addressed where the nodes can redistribute the import
request to other glance-api nodes for processing avoiding
the need of shared filesystem between the nodes for staging.

As rabbitMQ requires x509 auth for TLS communication it's
out of the scope of this change and should be addressed on
follow-up patch.

Suitable test cases should be added once identified.

related-bp: cluster-awareness

Change-Id: I591e2637bdef9c7bf01b021b3eec2a81aa45c21d

commit_message:
Reduce fact gathering

This change updates the default subset to only be the minimum list of
facts for ansible.  In the deployment we need to make sure that we only
collect the minimum amount of facts to perform the tasks at hand rather
than assume we have all the facts.

Depends-On: https://review.opendev.org/c/openstack/tripleo-heat-templates/+/775709
Depends-On: https://review.opendev.org/c/openstack/tripleo-ansible/+/775708
Related-Bug: #1915761
Change-Id: I61affe32dfc9eacbe514893168397c9b291b8713
(cherry picked from commit 0e81eb420e8974d7815b98e084a94885a1ff1b8b)

commit_message:
Handle containers without a namespace

Satellite server does not include a namespace when exposing containers.
This change fixes our image-serve metadata creation to understand this
concept and build the _catalog we provide correctly. We will only handle
two types of containers path structures with the image-serve.

   * host:port/namespace/container:tag
   * host:port/container:tag

Change-Id: I259a0d5fcbae8f8a6bbeffa5fdb744d3291315ad
Depends-On: https://review.opendev.org/c/openstack/tripleo-ansible/+/773967
Closes-Bug: #1913782
(cherry picked from commit 7e797317a33a5c5881a1e24b9666ae774ca224c0)

commit_message:
allow users to override nodepool settings for libvirt reproducer

copy the libvirt nodepool defaults from their hiding space
directly to the workspace of where users launch the reproducer.

This will allow users to customize the image, memory etc easily.

Change-Id: I41d98002fdd578cdd82adb48cabfc937370d5ba5

[{'created': '2021-02-24 15:38:42.000000000', 'message': "FC: Fix not flushing on detach

When doing multipathed Fibre Channel we may end up not flushing the
volume when disconnecting it if didn't find a multipath when doing
the connection.

The issue is caused by the `connect_volume` call returning a real path
instead of a symlink and us passing the wrong device_info to the
_remove_devices method, which makes the disconnect code incorrectly
identify when a multipath was used to decide whether to do a flush or
not.

necessary.

Closes-Bug: #1897787
Change-Id: Ie3266c81b3c6bb5a2c213a12410539d404d1febe
(cherry picked from commit 1432c369fb49b7359bd9d48af24133f5c4019402)
(cherry picked from commit 3adcb40678ee771d6701e798f1f50ebce8b63aa3)
"}]
commit_message:
FC: Fix not flushing on detach

When doing multipathed Fibre Channel we may end up not flushing the
volume when disconnecting it if didn't find a multipath when doing
the connection.

The issue is caused by the `connect_volume` call returning a real path
instead of a symlink and us passing the wrong device_info to the
_remove_devices method, which makes the disconnect code incorrectly
identify when a multipath was used to decide whether to do a flush or
not.

This patch fixes these things in order to flush the individual path when
necessary.

Closes-Bug: #1897787
Change-Id: Ie3266c81b3c6bb5a2c213a12410539d404d1febe
(cherry picked from commit 1432c369fb49b7359bd9d48af24133f5c4019402)

Delete gnocchi_identity_setup

This file duplicates the purpose of the service_setup.yml
so we're running same set of tasks twice.

[{'created': '2021-02-16 19:15:21.000000000', 'message': "Do not configure client as part of server role

We have separated galera_client and galera_server roles and there's no
need in dropping client file since that can be done by client part.

Change-Id: I88edfe87fd134bdbcf199a48443fc063740a8604
"}, {'created': '2021-02-17 18:11:50.000000000', 'message': 'Configure my.cnf for server when galera_root_user is not root

When galera_root_user is set to non-root user current behaviour is
to place my.cnf file as a part of the server setup, however
this non-root user is not created yet. User creation is handled
after server proper bootstrap and handlers flush. Having my.cnf
file in place makes bootstrap script fail, since it tries to use
credentials from this file which are not valid yet.

Instead we allow client part of the role to configure my.cnf
on metal deployments and set galera_root_user credentials
in it once user is properly created

Change-Id: I88edfe87fd134bdbcf199a48443fc063740a8604
'}]
commit_message:
Configure my.cnf for server when galera_root_user is not root

When galera_root_user is set to non-root user current behaviour is
to place my.cnf file as a part of the server setup, however
this non-root user is not created yet. User creation is handled
after server proper bootstrap and handlers flush. Having my.cnf
file in place makes bootstrap script fail, since it tries to use
credentials from this file which are not valid yet.

Instead we allow client part of the role to configure my.cnf
on metal deployments and set galera_root_user credentials
in it once user is properly created

Change-Id: I88edfe87fd134bdbcf199a48443fc063740a8604

revisions:
[{'created': '2021-02-23 22:03:52.000000000', 'message': "DNM: Testing public shares policy change

Manila's dropping deprecated public share policies.
Lets see if any tests break in the client here.

Depends-On: I6e7608be57de8987117f3f4ace018a7eb91c8bd2
Change-Id: I57111b676487fef0c82f749e90b165465151f0c1
"}, {'created': '2021-02-23 23:07:34.000000000', 'message': 'Change public share tests

Manila changed the default RBAC policy
for public shares in the Stein release
but maintained compatibility to the older
expectation that regular/unprivileged
users could create public shares, or
modify private shares to become public [1].

This compatibility is being dropped [2]
So we must adjust the functional test
expectations here.

[1] https://review.opendev.org/634864
[2] https://review.opendev.org/776869

Depends-On: I6e7608be57de8987117f3f4ace018a7eb91c8bd2
Change-Id: I57111b676487fef0c82f749e90b165465151f0c1
Signed-off-by: Goutham Pacha Ravi <gouthampravi@gmail.com>
'}]
commit_message:
Change public share tests

Manila changed the default RBAC policy
for public shares in the Stein release
but maintained compatibility to the older
expectation that regular/unprivileged
users could create public shares, or
modify private shares to become public [1].

This compatibility is being dropped [2]
So we must adjust the functional test
expectations here.

[1] https://review.opendev.org/634864
[2] https://review.opendev.org/776869

Depends-On: I6e7608be57de8987117f3f4ace018a7eb91c8bd2
Change-Id: I57111b676487fef0c82f749e90b165465151f0c1
Signed-off-by: Goutham Pacha Ravi <gouthampravi@gmail.com>

revisions:
[{'created': '2021-03-03 02:27:14.000000000', 'message': "add enabled to segment

Sometimes, operators want to temporarily close instance-ha function.
This patch add 'enabled' to segment. If the segment 'enabled' value
is set False, all notifications of this segment will be ignored
and no recovery methods will execuate.

Change-Id: I1a49a745e26acdfbc48b413ab18dd755e4ad5839
"}]
commit_message:
add enabled to segment

Sometimes, operators want to temporarily close instance-ha function.
This patch add 'enabled' to segment. If the segment 'enabled' value
is set False, all notifications of this segment will be ignored
and no recovery methods will execuate.

Implements: BP enable-to-segment
Change-Id: I1a49a745e26acdfbc48b413ab18dd755e4ad5839

commit_message:
Update rbac api version for keystone

When using a helm3 to deploy , it fails. Helm3 no more support rbac.authorization.k8s.io/v1beta1 , but v1 can support helm2 and helm3.

Change-Id: If37ec26443feb5328d49e6b3c419305832bdae9e

I commented on the bug report, can you include the version of Octavia you are running?

There was an Oslo/PBR change that caused our Octavia configuration file to not be loaded at all. This has been fixed, but may not be present in your version of Octavia.'}, {'account_id': 11628, 'date': '2021-03-02 16:44:20.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 7: Code-Review-1

I am asking because the configuration is always "looked up" in Octavia to support mutable configurations (plus it is a best practice). We don't cache configuration settings like some other projects do.'}, {'account_id': 9816, 'date': '2021-03-02 22:46:43.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 7:

> Patch Set 7:
> 
> I commented on the bug report, can you include the version of Octavia you are running?
> 
> There was an Oslo/PBR change that caused our Octavia configuration file to not be loaded at all. This has been fixed, but may not be present in your version of Octavia.

We are seeing the issue in stable/train (5.0.3).'}, {'account_id': 11628, 'date': '2021-03-03 00:52:31.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 7:

I have looked into this issue deeper and I think Greg's existing patch for this[1] is the best, consistent, solution. We should not be setting defaults in the WSME types if we can avoid it.

[1] https://review.opendev.org/c/openstack/octavia/+/777938"}, {'account_id': 9816, 'date': '2021-03-03 01:19:57.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 7:

Thank you Michael, for your feedback.
I'll abandon this change then."}, {'account_id': 9816, 'date': '2021-03-03 01:20:03.000000000', 'content': 'Abandoned'}]
revisions:
[{'created': '2021-03-01 10:28:59.000000000', 'message': 'Defer import of octavia.api.config

When octavia.api.config is imported, it also triggers import of
octavia.api.v2.types.* which were included by octavia.db.models.
Because this import is called in a very early stage before config files
are loaded, some modules are initialized with the default config value
instead of the actual value written in octavia.conf.

This change defers import of the octavia.api.config modules so that
it is included only after the config file is actually loaded.

Story 2008666
Task 41953

commit_message:
Defer import of octavia.api.config

When octavia.api.config is imported, it also triggers import of
octavia.api.v2.types.* which were included by octavia.db.models.
Because this import is called in a very early stage before config files
are loaded, some modules are initialized with the default config value
instead of the actual value written in octavia.conf.

This change defers import of the octavia.api.config modules so that
it is included only after config files are actually loaded.

Story 2008666
Task 41953

Change-Id: I11083f3917b0f3694d7d7a7f87a47ce612fccfd8

commit_message:
Fix IPv6 cidr used by public network in tempest-slow job

Same issue was fixed in tempest in [1] but it isn't in tempest 26.0.0
so when tempest was pinned to that version in stable/stein jobs, it
started failing with the error like described in [2].

This patch makes the same fix as was done in Tempest but in Neutron repo
for stable/stein job only.

[1] https://review.opendev.org/c/openstack/tempest/+/774764
[2] https://bugs.launchpad.net/neutron/+bug/1914037

Change-Id: I0aca489715ddd0da97036e75c5c4265b713c19b8

revisions:
[{'created': '2021-02-02 14:21:14.000000000', 'message': 'translation: Handle renaming of Chinese locales in Django

Horizon is switching Chinese locales from zh-cn/zh-tw to zh-hans/zh-hant
in horizon and horizon plugins.
This change follows Django change which happend more than five years ago
and the new language code form is commonly used.

Language codes in Zanata are not changed, so we need to covert the
relevant language codes in propose_translation_update.sh.
It allows us to avoid doing it manually and also allows us to
switch these language codes almost once across horizon and plugins.

The detail will be posted to the mailing list.

Change-Id: I1420508f0513c52866aa637784a51f7c22f6d204

commit_message:
translation: Handle renaming of Chinese locales in Django

Horizon is switching Chinese locales from zh-cn/zh-tw to zh-hans/zh-hant
in horizon and horizon plugins.
This change follows Django change which happend more than five years ago
and the new language code form is commonly used.

Language codes in Zanata are not changed, so we need to covert the
relevant language codes in propose_translation_update.sh.
It allows us to avoid doing it manually and also allows us to
switch these language codes almost once across horizon and plugins.

The detail is explained in the mailing list post.
http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-discuss/2021-February/020169.html

Change-Id: I1420508f0513c52866aa637784a51f7c22f6d204

commit_message:
Use ansible_facts instead

In order to ANSIBLE_INJECT_FACT_VARS=False we have to use ansible_facts
instead of ansible_* vars. This change switches our distribution and
hostname related items to use ansible_facts instead.

Change-Id: Id01e754f0cf9f6e98c02f45a4011f3d6f59f80a1
Related-Bug: #1915761
(cherry picked from commit e7bc62c20e6017704fbdd476ce9143e23f8504ec)

We've seen that large amount of facts for hosts have a direct impact on

commit_message:
Reduce fact gathering

We've seen that large amount of facts for hosts have a direct impact on
task execution as part of the deployment.  This change reduces the
amount of data that we are collecting when we use facts and leverages
more targeted methods to collect the required information.

Change-Id: I49e6ca02c2b4791641fb27ebf258ef6c9d52dd9e
Related-Bug: #1915761
(cherry picked from commit f6c0acc7fe7e4571fc923d85422d7781b6d35151)

commit_message:
Make functional tests set node_staging_uri

Currently it is not possible to configure the staging directory
URI of the functional workers. We need to be able to do that in order
to enable the stage cleaning behavior. Right now, they're all sharing
/tmp/staging, which will cause workers to conflict while running in
parallel. This causes them to use their private test directory,
which may also help some other spurious failures due to interaction.

Related-Bug: #1913625
Change-Id: Ic2ac2a528206c50c38e948a096daf9eb8e5eb715

commit_message:
apidb: Compact Newton database migrations

Specific changes include:

- Add 'instance_uuid' and 'instance' columns to 'build_requests' table
  (013)
- Add index covering 'instance_uuid' column of 'build_requests' table
  (013)
- Add unique constraint covering 'instance_uuid' column of
  'build_requests' table (013)
- Add 'keypairs' table (014)
- Drop foreign key constraint covering 'request_spec_id' of
  'build_requests' table (015)
- Drop unique constraint covering 'request_spec_id' of 'build_requests'
  table (015)
- Alter 'request_spec_id', 'user_id', 'security_groups' and
  'config_drive' columns of 'build_requests' table to be nullable (015)
- Add 'resource_providers', 'inventories', 'allocations', and
  'resource_provider_aggregates' tables (016)
- Add 'aggregate', 'aggregate_hosts' and 'aggregate_metadata' tables
  (017)
- Add 'groups', 'group_policy' and 'group_member' tables (018)
- Add 'block_device_mappings' column to 'build_requests' table (019)
- Alter 'block_device_mappings' column of 'build_requests' table to be
  'MediumText' (020)

Change-Id: I944a0ed33d9ac8bda81a4e09a33e8fd768b6f95d
Signed-off-by: Stephen Finucane <stephenfin@redhat.com>

commit_message:
Switch cloud.networking.qos* operations to rely on proxy layer

This change switches Neutron Qos* operations in the cloud layer to use
the proxy layer instead of reimplementing direct requests.

Change-Id: Ide4125caa6c45e8d7d985b3e6a227a619ac94c40

revisions:
[{'created': '2021-03-02 08:50:28.000000000', 'message': 'Reduce number of the workers in fullstack gate job

Fullstack job is using different tox env in the gate
(dsvm-fullstack-gate). To reduce memory usage in that job, some
time ago, in patch [1] we reduced number of test workers from 4
to 3. But it was done for "dsvm-fullstack" tox env, not for
"dsvm-fullstack-gate" thus it had no effect on our CI runs.
Now it is changed also in the CI job's tox env.

[1] https://review.opendev.org/c/openstack/neutron/+/764907

Change-Id: Iec949922be0779a00bf405c2f1d5646c588d323c
Related-Bug: #1906366
'}]
commit_message:
Reduce number of the workers in fullstack gate job

Fullstack job is using different tox env in the gate
(dsvm-fullstack-gate). To reduce memory usage in that job, some
time ago, in patch [1] we reduced number of test workers from 4
to 3. But it was done for "dsvm-fullstack" tox env, not for
"dsvm-fullstack-gate" thus it had no effect on our CI runs.
Now it is changed also in the CI job's tox env.

[1] https://review.opendev.org/c/openstack/neutron/+/764907

Change-Id: Iec949922be0779a00bf405c2f1d5646c588d323c
Related-Bug: #1906366

check-rdo'}, {'account_id': 21129, 'date': '2021-03-01 04:15:57.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3:

Yes, I see how this fails when the map_merge references a non-existing dict from another template.

I'd like to see the cinder-volume and cinder-backup services handled the same way, but notice this patch doesn't touch cinder-backup-pacemaker-puppet.yaml. However, I don't think the pcmk templates need to pull in the non-pcmk template as its "base" (which contains an entry for rsyslog in the service_config_settings), and then have the pcmk template map_merge the exact same rsyslog setting.

What if the non-pcmk templates for cinder-backup and cinder-volume defined the "base" service_config_settings (which would include the rsyslog stuff), and the pcmk version of the templates simple pull in the "base" template's service_config_settings. No need to map_merge rsyslog into the pcmk templates if we know the value is already present in the base template.'}, {'account_id': 24245, 'date': '2021-03-01 08:04:18.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 4.'}, {'account_id': 24245, 'date': '2021-03-01 08:06:20.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 4:

> 
> I'd like to see the cinder-volume and cinder-backup services handled the same way, but notice this patch doesn't touch cinder-backup-pacemaker-puppet.yaml. However, I don't think the pcmk templates need to pull in the non-pcmk template as its "base" (which contains an entry for rsyslog in the service_config_settings), and then have the pcmk template map_merge the exact same rsyslog setting.
> 
> What if the non-pcmk templates for cinder-backup and cinder-volume defined the "base" service_config_settings (which would include the rsyslog stuff), and the pcmk version of the templates simple pull in the "base" template's service_config_settings. No need to map_merge rsyslog into the pcmk templates if we know the value is already present in the base template.

Thanks Alan, I think I understand what you mean. I updated the patch. Let me know if I didn't get it quite right.'}, {'account_id': 24245, 'date': '2021-03-01 13:03:51.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 4:

trying to merge dict with null and passing a list of

commit_message:
Fix logging_sources map_merge issues

Fixes an issue where map_merge was used incorrectly,
trying to merge dict with null and passing a list of
only one map.

This caused the map merge not to happen, and the
$RoleServiceChain output to carry the actual map_merge
in service_config_settings instead of the intended
merged map of rsyslog logging_sources.

Closes-Bug: #1917195
Change-Id: I529f91d5391d24bb5a6af37d3486f6ddf6cabac7

[Spectrum Virtualize Family] Data_reduction is a pool specific property,
this property should be saved for a specific pool during initialisation.

With this, calls to get_pool_attrs can be reduced everytime create_vdisk
is called, in order to check if pool is a data_reduction_pool.

closes bug: #1890591

Change-Id: I00f1bd46bc8715591016f59c32651fc2c9cddf35
(cherry picked from commit 7d89890704ef2ed9265a5dec9cbe47cb1ffc5aaa)

commit_message:
[SVF]:Reduce slowness by caching pool information

[Spectrum Virtualize Family] Data_reduction is a pool specific property,
this property should be saved for a specific pool during initialisation.

With this, calls to get_pool_attrs can be reduced everytime create_vdisk
is called, in order to check if pool is a data_reduction_pool.

closes bug: #1890591

Change-Id: I00f1bd46bc8715591016f59c32651fc2c9cddf35
(cherry picked from commit 7d89890704ef2ed9265a5dec9cbe47cb1ffc5aaa)
(cherry picked from commit e2cddc108b174895b3575e9a2640d3cd8afc21ab)

[{'created': '2021-02-09 15:28:14.000000000', 'message': 'Require oslo.serialization 3.1.2

Older versions cause the RBD driver to break
when using JSON logging.  (bug #1908607)

Change-Id: I510b5b4a2fd4b62ecfcfa7d8604a716513cbc6e8
'}]
commit_message:
Require oslo.serialization 3.1.2

Older versions cause the RBD driver to break
when using JSON logging.  (bug #1908607)

Change-Id: I510b5b4a2fd4b62ecfcfa7d8604a716513cbc6e8

commit_message:
Drop lower-constraints testing

The OpenStack community consensus seems to be that it's not worth the
hassle of fixing. *Maybe* we can revisit this if we ever drop py2
support?

Reasonable spot to start on ML threads:
http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-discuss/2021-January/019672.html

Change-Id: Ibf0c891782afe014cc453b713a94c187340d172e
Depends-On: https://review.opendev.org/c/openstack/requirements/+/777025
(cherry picked from commit 06b36ae0e2ee6054162bfb1d9f3cdda39eacbad5)

subject: Fix CI_WIKI_NAME entries
messages:
[{'account_id': 11904, 'date': '2021-02-18 13:57:34.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 11904, 'date': '2021-02-18 13:59:34.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

Script that can be used to test generating yaml needed by third_party_scorecard:

```
#! /bin/bash

cd /tmp
git clone -q --depth 1 https://opendev.org/openstack/cinder
cd cinder

CIS=$(grep -r "CI_WIKI_NAME =" * | grep -E "volume|zone" | sed -E "s/\"|'//g" | tr -s ' ' | cut -d ' ' -f 4 | sort | uniq)

cd ..
rm -fr cinder

echo "openstack/cinder:" > ~/ci_names.log

for CI in $(echo $CIS); do
	echo $CI
	curl -sS "https://wiki.openstack.org/wiki/ThirdPartySystems/$CI" | grep "3rd party" | sed -E 's/<caption.*b>|<\/caption>//g' | sed 's/^ /    - /g';
done >> ~/ci_names.log
```'}, {'account_id': 26537, 'date': '2021-02-18 15:06:15.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

Build succeeded.

- cinder-iscsi http://cloudbase-ci.com/cinder/776458/1/iscsi/ : SUCCESS in 1h 03m 28s
- cinder-smb http://cloudbase-ci.com/cinder/776458/1/smb/ : SUCCESS in 1h 07m 35s'}, {'account_id': 28801, 'date': '2021-02-18 16:40:49.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

commit_message:
Fix CI_WIKI_NAME entries

A lot of drivers had CI_WIKI_NAME entries pointing to invalid third
party driver pages [0]. This updates them so we can automate pulling
CI account information when generating the CI status report.

[0] https://wiki.openstack.org/wiki/ThirdPartySystems

Signed-off-by: Sean McGinnis <sean.mcginnis@gmail.com>
Change-Id: I85855921894dddee3d3a4381129417a960796749

messages: [{'account_id': 20778, 'date': '2021-03-01 13:19:24.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Cherry Picked from branch master.'}, {'account_id': 20172, 'date': '2021-03-01 14:39:42.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+2'}, {'account_id': 14985, 'date': '2021-03-02 17:14:02.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+2 Workflow+1'}]
revisions:
[{'created': '2021-03-01 13:19:24.000000000', 'message': 'Upgrade mariadb storage during upgrade tasks

When a tripleo major upgrade or FFU causes an update or mariadb
to a new major version (e.g. 10.1 -> 10.3), some internal DB
tables must be upgraded (myisam tables), and sometimes the
existing user tables may be migrated to new mariadb defaults.

Move the db-specific upgrade steps into a dedicated script and
make sure that it is called at the right time while upgrading
the undercloud and/or the overcloud.

Closes-Bug: #1913438

Change-Id: I92353622994b28c895d95bdcbe348a73b6c6bb99
(cherry picked from commit 712cfcc71bb9061082154460a6e04a619055f0a0)
'}]
commit_message:
Upgrade mariadb storage during upgrade tasks

When a tripleo major upgrade or FFU causes an update or mariadb
to a new major version (e.g. 10.1 -> 10.3), some internal DB
tables must be upgraded (myisam tables), and sometimes the
existing user tables may be migrated to new mariadb defaults.

Move the db-specific upgrade steps into a dedicated script and
make sure that it is called at the right time while upgrading
the undercloud and/or the overcloud.

Closes-Bug: #1913438

Change-Id: I92353622994b28c895d95bdcbe348a73b6c6bb99
(cherry picked from commit 712cfcc71bb9061082154460a6e04a619055f0a0)

commit_message:
Implement secure RBAC for quotas

This commit updates the policies for quotas to understand scope checking and
account for a read-only role. This is part of a broader series of changes
across OpenStack to provide a consistent RBAC experience and improve security.

Change-Id: Id3f3192fb9948f71b0b9cb03d2ef8ffd0b770620

Remove default plan-environment.yaml references

Now, we only use it to specify the derive parameter
playbooks.

commit_message:
Implement secure RBAC for quota classes

This commit updates the policies for quota classes to understand scope checking
and account for a read-only role. This is part of a broader series of changes
across OpenStack to provide a consistent RBAC experience and improve security.

Change-Id: I5c8ebcf72ab158021deab772693b869c35962a2b

commit_message:
Add ability to specify memcached port

The port defaults to hiera('memcached_authtoken_port', 11211)
for authtoken middleware and hiera('memcached_port', 11211)
for other uses. Different ports might be set for security
and performance tuning.

Change-Id: I567d6b2cd66d5eb98971cd54987c1fbea3c1da78
(cherry picked from commit f460e659ba72a99d21b5aa69d9099c42cc868cfc)

commit_message:
Remove tripleo-multinode-container-minimal from layout + fix test

The tripleo-multinode-container-minimal is being deprecated [1]
as part of wider tripleo CI optimization at [2].

This updates test-requirements to fix issue seen in [3] and also
fixes a failing pep8 test seen after test-requirements was fixed.

[1] Ie6473759383bd4b903cbe56fba9fee75a24154c4
[2] https://review.opendev.org/q/topic:tripleo-ci-reduce
[3] https://a28720641abd1053931d-69746c322fe5e3cf8e2976f654b96d92.ssl.cf5.rackcdn.com/777098/1/check/openstack-tox-py38/9e6a3c0/tox/py38-1.log

subject: Always set NetworkDeploymentActions to its default
messages: [{'account_id': 8833, 'date': '2021-02-16 09:22:29.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Cherry Picked from branch stable/victoria.'}, {'account_id': 7144, 'date': '2021-02-23 17:07:28.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+2'}, {'account_id': 14985, 'date': '2021-03-02 14:37:14.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+2 Workflow+1'}]
revisions:
[{'created': '2021-02-16 09:22:29.000000000', 'message': "Always set NetworkDeploymentActions to its default

There are instances users use ``NetworkDeploymentActions`` to
do network configuration during update, but just drop the
parameter for subsequent updates. This sometimes results in
network configuration changes in existing nodes and disruptions.
Let's always set them to defaults unless overridden explicitly.

Change-Id: Ibe7925e4ee568d3d45e138d543b6d7064a8503a3
Related: https://bugzilla.redhat.com/1928055
(cherry picked from commit 92dcffc714bc92a28f610bf0322f04551aade758)
"}]
commit_message:
Always set NetworkDeploymentActions to its default

There are instances users use ``NetworkDeploymentActions`` to
do network configuration during update, but just drop the
parameter for subsequent updates. This sometimes results in
network configuration changes in existing nodes and disruptions.
Let's always set them to defaults unless overridden explicitly.

Change-Id: Ibe7925e4ee568d3d45e138d543b6d7064a8503a3
Related: https://bugzilla.redhat.com/1928055
(cherry picked from commit 92dcffc714bc92a28f610bf0322f04551aade758)

revisions:
[{'created': '2019-10-02 21:37:12.000000000', 'message': 'WIP/PoC:Add RBAC tests

This proof of concept leverages the nine default personas available
in tempest to demonstrate a potential framework for testing default
policies. In this example, an abstract base class is created that helps
set up credentials and outlines every policy that needs to be tested,
then nine subclasses are created to test every persona. Each test
represents one policy rule, and some tests make multiple requests in
order to test the policy from different approaches, for example, to
check what happens if a different domain is specified, or what happens
if the resource does not exist.

The idea here is to be very verbose and explicit about what is being
tested: every policy gets one test in the base class, and each persona
is tested in a subclass. The layout should be easy to understand and
someone reading the code should not be left guessing whether a case is
missing or if there is magic happening in the background that is causing
a false positive or false negative.

Depends-on: [tba]

Change-Id: Icb5317b9297230490bd783fe9b07c8db244c06f8

'}, {'created': '2020-01-14 23:45:15.000000000', 'message': 'WIP/PoC:Add RBAC tests

This proof of concept leverages the nine default personas available
in tempest[1] to demonstrate a potential framework for testing default
policies. In this example, an abstract base class is created that helps
set up credentials and outlines every policy that needs to be tested,
then nine subclasses are created to test every persona. Each test
represents one policy rule, and some tests make multiple requests in
order to test the policy from different approaches, for example, to
check what happens if a different domain is specified, or what happens
if the resource does not exist.

The idea here is to be very verbose and explicit about what is being
tested: every policy gets one test in the base class, and each persona
is tested in a subclass. The layout should be easy to understand and
someone reading the code should not be left guessing whether a case is
missing or if there is magic happening in the background that is causing
a false positive or false negative.

[1] https://review.opendev.org/686306 (this will require additional
devstack and keystone configuration to work properly in CI)

Depends-on: https://review.opendev.org/686306
Depends-on: https://review.opendev.org/699051
Depends-on: https://review.opendev.org/699519
Depends-on: https://review.opendev.org/700826

This proof of concept leverages the nine default personas available
in tempest[1] to demonstrate a potential framework for testing default
policies. In this example, an abstract base class is created that helps
set up credentials and outlines every policy that needs to be tested,
then nine subclasses are created to test every persona. Each test
represents one policy rule, and some tests make multiple requests in
order to test the policy from different approaches, for example, to
check what happens if a different domain is specified, or what happens
if the resource does not exist.

The idea here is to be very verbose and explicit about what is being
tested: every policy gets one test in the base class, and each persona
is tested in a subclass. The layout should be easy to understand and
someone reading the code should not be left guessing whether a case is
missing or if there is magic happening in the background that is causing
a false positive or false negative.

[1] https://review.opendev.org/686306 (this will require additional
devstack and keystone configuration to work properly in CI)

Depends-on: https://review.opendev.org/686306
